text: Slightly hazy golden colour, dissipating white head. Floral aroma, grapes, white wine, light cucumber. Quite sour flavour, lactic, cucumber, hint of apricot, white wine. Finish white wine, sour notes.(from 50cL can @ The in-laws, Atlantic Heights. Thanks so much for the can, Dough!!!)

Pours a clear golden/orange with very little head...some thin white bubbles. Aroma has a slight sweetness not unlike mountain dew...sone light citrus, muted pair, and a fleeting berry note. Flavor is tart and almost salty liike a gose...lemony with a notable cactus/agave funkiness...minerally. mouthfeel is light and lively with a dry, tart lemony/grainy finish. Really nice and complex beer.
Sourd In September 2015. Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head. Soft musk, faint sweetness. Medium bodied, light honey and funk. Soft tart grain, funk and musk into the finish.
On tap at CJs. Poured a golden color with a small sized head. Citrus, fruity / sour fruits, and a nice tart finish. Easy drinker.

Can. Pours crystal clear pale golden with a small fizzy white head that dissipates quickly leaving minimal lacing. Aroma is wheat, lemon, pretty simple. Flavor is wheat and lemon with a light fruitiness. Very light sweetness on top of a light tartness. Not really complex but certainly quite drinkable.
16oz can thanks to Darrel. Pours out a light straw color topped with a small white head. Nose is nice fruit notes some light tartness. Taste is more of the fruit tart wheat some brine notes even.

Aroma: Light Fruit, Cactus

Appearance: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, Thin White Head Ring, No Lacing

Taste: Pear, Cactus, Mild Apple

Mouthfeel; Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart, Mildly Watery

Poured a pale yellow color from the can with aromas of light prickly pear, hay, some light musk. Flavors are sour pear with juice, hay, light funk. Light and refreshing I really liked this one thanks Dmac for the can.
On tap at whole foods. Pours clear pale gold with white head. Pear citrus lemon, a hint of barnyard. Lightly sour and sweet. Light crisp body.

Pours pale yellow with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of lemon, sour fruits, peaches, salt, pear, and some lacto. Taste is similar to the aroma. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a bone dry, pretty sour,long finish. Overall, a tasty, refreshing sour.
Pours a light hazy gold with no head. Aroma of sour wheat, citrus and tropical fruit. Taste is tart, lemons and berries with a nice crisp wheat finish. So refreshing but with a ton of flavor.

On draft at the mile, pours Clearish golden with decent sized white top. Mouthfeel is light. Notes are lactic and tropical wheat with some sour cherry, pear and cereal malt/oat especially in the aftertaste. Sessionable. Pretty solid berliner from carton but it tastes like alot of others from the same style.
Hazy golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of lacto, sweeter fruit, lemon peel. Taste of lemon, sweeter fruitiness, and a tart finish.

Can. Huge thanks to Dave for grabbing it. Pours out the same lightly cloudy golden color with a small foamy head. Aroma is of sour tartness, some ripe pear, sweet fruit, light lemonade some wheat. Taste is complex and smooth, great balance of tartness and funk, some ripe pear, sweet fruit, some funk, light basement notes and some wheat malt. Another great beer from Carton, could drink this all day.
Light gold pour with a smaller white head. Tart aroma, citrus, pair, sour. Pear and citrus up front, citrus becomes more prominent as it warms. touch of lactic sourness, oak. Lighter body.
Can. Pours yellow white head. Nose/taste of sour fruit, oak, berry and lactose sourness - medium body.

Received as a bonus; can poured into an imperial pint glass -- a hazy straw color that smells fruity and yeasty. Flavor is great! Simple and tart that steady increases from subtle to apparent and finishes with a balanced sweetness from the prickly pear. Well done!

16oz can via 4 pack from the brewery. Thanks for the pick up dmacaroni!! Pours a slightly hazy straw color with a small fizzy white head. Aroma of acidic lemon, hay, yeast, and some sweet fruit. Taste minces the nose. This is a nice light sour. Solid

Can. Straw colored with medium white head. Aroma is musty, wheat and biscuit. Taste is tart, lactic, lemon, passion fruit and wheat. Thinnish mouthfeel, tight carb and quick finish. Super crushable. Excellent.

16 oz. can from Carton. Pours a slightly hazy light yellow. No head or lacing. An tangy aroma, somewhat pungent (but not in a bad way). Acerbic, citrus flavors, fairly crisp mouthfeel despite the sour notes. All in all, this is an excellent summer sour.

16oz can from the brewery. Poured a hazed dirty light gild body with a smaller mostly white head. Aroma is pleasantly tart, fruity, lemon, acidic, wet toast. Palate is medium with tight bubbly carbonation and a long lingering tart aftertaste. Flavor is fruity, light pear notes, loads of tartness, lemon, acidity and wet wheat. This is good stuff.

Can. Bright shining yellow, no head. Tart and sour aroma, a little salty. Sweet tart taste up front followed by a burst of very green vegetal, tropical flavor. Green apples and pears on the long finish. Perfect light summer time sour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Light golden pour with white head. Sweet cactus pear fruit, tart fruit, and Berliner aromas. Light sweet fruit, mild tart flavors. Crushable!
